column3:
utACK 0d9af79e5084dc2fb6a73abd9dd113dda4e993b4

We need another PR to honor logips=0
Honoring logips=0 is beyond the scope of this PR, various other things need to be fixed too.\n
No strong feelings either way about the errors. Switching the debug stuff to "net" is obviously a good change, though.\n

This is certainly not perfect, but is am improvement.

utACK 0d9af79e5084dc2fb6a73abd9dd113dda4e993b4
94fd1d8 makes the last remaining common non-ERROR more informative and less scary.\n

Followed @laanwj suggestion to add Socks5ErrorString() to decode error responses from socks proxy.

Note the separate LogPrintf in 94fd1d8d53adceb80e5a41cc6438c7704aeac0f7 is outside of what Socks5ErrorString() can decode.

Is this sufficient, do you want a squash?

Looks good to me, thanks.\nYes the case in  https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/94fd1d8d53adceb80e5a41cc6438c7704aeac0f7 is separate, that doesn't matter, it's not an error returned from the proxy server but a local network error (so it wouldn't belong in `Socks5ErrorString`).\n
I'd prefer assigning the error to a string here (or make a `string Socks5ErrorString(code)` function), instead of repeating the `Socks5() connect to %s:%d failed` on every line.\n

@phantomcircuit informs me that other non-error cases here print scary "ERROR:" messages outside of `if (pchRet2[1] != 0x00)`, so it is not straight forward to make a function that decodes only the Socks5ErrorString().  I originally thought about adding a function similar to error() but then I was told all of this needs to be rewritten for the network rewrite so don't worry about it for now.\n

Yes, this has been rewritten anyway. Adding to what @laanwj said, it'd be useful to have the code in the return so that the caller could react appropriately (for ex "address type not supported" should be a hint not to try that type again). In the refactored code, this returns a general type error (connection failed/proxy failed/etc), as well as a specific failure type.\n
